CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 18, 1960, pg .5 reads: "10. Althea Gibson community relations representative for Ward Baking Company, also famous as the world's most renowned women's tennis champion, served as an additional attraction to both the Tip-Top Bread booth and the home show as she signed autographs, played ping-pong with Sir Walter of WAMO and made three athletic award presentations to the outstanding high school athletes. Shown with here are Dorothy Thomas and Vincent Halloran."
TitMainTitle: Tennis champion Althea Gibson, seated with Dorothy Thomas and Vincent Halloran in Tip Top Bakers booth in Syria Mosque for the 1960 Courier-WAMO Home-A-Rama
